results.title: Classroom crisis: dealing with violence in school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Bell Associates, Bruce Johnson and Dave Bell
results.brief_description: Violence presents a real danger for teachers. Dr. Fred Feitler of Youngstown State University has developed strategies for dealing with student fights, physical assaults, disciplinary confrontations and other crisis situations.

results.title: Classifying plants and animals
results.brief_description: A short history of classification, introducing Linnaeus’ system of binomial nomenclature. Animation is used to show how Linnaeus’ system works. The classification of the common dog is traced.

results.title: Classifying by computer
results.brief_description: Explains how statistical treatment of survey data and construction of a classification can be done by a suitably programmed computer. Takes us step by step thorugh the process from collection of data, through programming, to final results.

results.title: Classic rock: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains fourteen classic rock anthems from an array of British musicians, performed live. The tracks are: Wishbone Ash “Blowin’ free”; Argent “Hold your head up”; The Sensational Alex Harvey band “Delilah”; Uriah Heep “Return to fantasy”; Asia “Heat of the moment”; Focus “Sylvia”; Emerson, Lake & Palmer “The Barbarian”; Family “Strange band”; Curved air “Melinda more or less”; Slade “Get down and get with it”; Deep Purple “Child in time”; Free “I’ll be moving”; Thin Lizzy “The Sun goes down”; Barclay James Harvest “Mockingbird”.

results.title: Classic old, exciting new
results.brief_description: This film shows the work of the Australian Museum’s many sections - the storage facilities, the maintenance necessary, the preparation of exhibits and the research and publications sections. All are of vital importance to the preservation of our Australian heritage.

results.title: Classic Fairy Tales
results.brief_description: Puss in Boots, “The Ugly Duckling”, “Rapunzel”, “The Four Musicians”, “The Emperor’s New Clothes”, and “The Princess and the Pea”. Six of the finest tales from the great fairy story tellers - Hans Christian Anderson, The Brothers Grimm and Charles Perrault. Each story is presented in a new, colourful and lively style but yet retains the best of traditional story telling. The stories are funny, tender, exciting and sometimes a little scary - tales which children will want to see and hear again and again. Rated: G

results.title: Classic Everest
results.brief_description: Looks at a group of ordinary people as they travel part way up Mount Everest. the group is led by tashi tensing, grandson of the famous sherpa who accompanied Hilary on the first successful climb of Everest. Also includes rare footage of the bones claimed to be from the famous Yeti, along with the Mani Rhindu festival at the Tenboche Monastry.
